item.title: Dates
item.description: Dates Paper submission deadline: November 17th, 2023 Paper notification: January 8th, 2024 Camera Ready Deadline: February 2nd, 2024

item.title: Call for papers
item.description: Recent trends in computer science promoted new ways to think about software at both design time and run time. Next-generation intelligent pervasive systems will be modelled as digital twins that are counterparts of physical objects and executed in parallel. Moreover, combining the mirroring of the physical entities – that allows for continuous observation of the real world and the corresponding update of the digital replica – with computational intelligence enables the individual devices to operate responsibly towards their goals.

item.title: Organization
item.description: Committees Organising Committee Lukas Esterkle: Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering - Aarhus University, Denmark Sara Montagna, Department of Pure and Applied Science - University of Urbino Carlo Bo, Italy Danilo Pianini, Department of Computer Science and Engineering - University of Bologna, Italy Program Committee Angelo Croatti, AUSL Romagna, Italy Alessandro Ricci, University of Bologna, Italy
